intro: Polygaloides chamaebuxus, commonly known as the dwarf milkweed, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. This species is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
